intro: Spermacoce exilis, commonly known as the slender spurge or small bladder grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, narrow leaves and produces small, round, fleshy fruits known as cocci. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Spermacoce exilis is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
